alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 21 at 12:05PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... East Fork Carson River Near Gardnerville affecting Douglas and Alpine Counties. West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing will accelerate snow melt. While the Walker River system continues to be the main concern, the East Fork Carson River Near Gardnerville could still climb into minor flood stage late Sunday night. Cloud cover may reduce snowmelt, but afternoon thunderstorms may offset this if heavy rain falls in a particular basin. For the East Fork Carson River...including Gardnerville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Walker Above Topaz Lake...including Little Walker and Coleville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands, pastures and some rural roads from the West Walker River Canyon to Topaz Lake .including Walker Coleville and Topaz California. Similar to peak of June 2011, and slightly below the peak of June 2017. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 6.4 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.3 feet on 05/28/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water will be swift moving and very cold. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday by 2 PM PDT.
